data.title: Power and Convenience Unleashed - 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip
data.body:
The 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip has proven to be a game-changer in setting up efficient and organized workspaces for both my wife and daughter. This product seamlessly combines practical design with functionality, making it an excellent addition to any home or office setup.

The layout of the power strip is well thought out, with 8 widely spaced outlets strategically placed for convenience. The arrangement of 4 outlets on top and 2 on each side ensures easy accessibility, allowing for the hassle-free connection of various devices without any overcrowding issues.

The inclusion of 3 USB ports and 1 USB-C port, with a total of 4.2A, is a standout feature. This provides more than sufficient power for charging multiple devices simultaneously. It's a desk USB charging station that eliminates the need for additional adapters and keeps all charging needs in one centralized location.

The 6 feet extension cord adds flexibility to the setup, allowing for optimal placement of the power strip. The flat plug design and wall mount capability further enhance versatility, accommodating various workspace configurations.

Durability and performance have been exemplary. The power strip has been in use for the past month without any issues, delivering consistent and reliable power to all connected devices.

The positive experience with the first purchase led me to buy another for my daughter's desk. She, too, appreciates the design and functionality, using it to power her laptops and various devices seamlessly.

In conclusion, the 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip is a stellar investment for anyone seeking an efficient and well-designed power solution. Its practical layout, USB charging capabilities, and overall reliability make it a top-tier choice.

data.title: Works perfect!
data.body: Arrived well packaged and ready to power! 6 foot cord is nice to get this power strip where ya need it. I like that it has a 90‚Å∞ plug so I don't have to worry about kinkong the power cord with furniture. Plenty of plug-ins for what I needed and fairly compact.

data.title: Works great and surprising!
data.body: OK this might sound crazy but this surge protector works great. The reason I say it‚Äôs a surprise is because I am a person who is blind. I wasn‚Äôt expecting the way it is made. I love the fact that it‚Äôs not like any other surge protector I have ever seen. It‚Äôs very small and compact. I got it because I used to nock my Internet cord from the wall all the time, and now I don‚Äôt have to worry about that!! of course I use it for other cords too! It‚Äôs cool, because the outlets are spaced apart enough that the cords don‚Äôt run into each other. You can take advantage of all the outlets if you need to. When I bought it, it was a great price too! It‚Äôs still on sale and I might buy it for a friend. Even though I don‚Äôt know this brand, I say you should get it while it is still on sale. However, the regular price is not so bad either but who doesn‚Äôt want a good deal!

data.title: Was exactly what I needed!
data.body: Purchased this to help essentially add a plug further down the wall. This gave me that! It was packaged well and it seems to be made of a higher quality and I expect it to hold up to the test of time. I like that it has 8 outlets and also 4 total USB plugs. Makes this versatile for a desk or office space as well or just an extension with additional plugs. So far so good! Would purchase this product again.

data.title: Great Design
data.body: I liked the compact design and versatility. The breaker might be a little weak. It tripped once with my space heater and one other low power device plugged in.

data.title: One cord to extend convenience.
data.body: often Your wall outlet is not close to an end table to place all your devices while charging. This solves the issue of a tangle of cords. The AC sockets have plently of elbow room if your still needing to plug in wall wart cubes to charge your devices. Plus in addition to 3 standard USB A sockets there is a USB C outlet . A total of 4.2 amps is the combined output which would allow two high current devices to charge at the same time. The rear has slots to wall mount the outlet. An on and off switch facilitates quick shut off . The device has Surge protection built in as added saftey for all your devices. This is a smart solution for a workbench or or craft table.

data.title: Versatile 8-Outlet Power Strip w/ USB
data.body:
I like that it does have a 6ft cord but is NOT vertical and long. I love the USB ports for my other items but this takes up far less room on my floor as it's NOT a long 8-plug strip. It looks nicer in the shape it's in with the cord yet accommodates all my cords without any problem. Will definitely buy for another room!

A.L. Walton

data.title: Buy it for the outlet layout and USB ports, not the surge protection.
data.body:
I don't trust these unknown products for serious surge protection. I basically consider them to be about the same as a regular "remote power tap" (power strip) with no surge protection, and I have it plugged in to a "real" surge protector on the wall outlet, but the socket layout on this product is excellent. Somehow I have managed to plug small "wall wart" sized plugs into EVERY outlet on ALL sides without any difficulty at all.

Granted, all the wall warts in this case are pretty small, but with most power strips almost always one of them blocks another outlet or something and at least one or two power sockets goes unused due to being blocked by something else. Amazingly, that hasn't happened yet with this one.

So this is a pretty major accomplishment in the field of industrial design here.

I also have this securely screwed down to the back of a desk using the keyholes on the back of the power tap. Unlike many poorly designed products out there, the keyholes on this power strip are of reasonable dimensions and I didn't have any trouble finding suitable screws in my random screw pile.

However, I really do not understand why almost no power strip manufacturer includes the screws needed to fit the keyhole dimensions on their product! This would be especially helpful in cases where the keyhole dimensions are metric and the product is sold in a country where most of the screws laying around are not metric

Please, for the love of god, please just include the mounting screws that match the product. I don't even want drywall anchors, just the screws that fit that are long enough to support the forces involved (weight of the strip, cables, AND force of unplugging things). It's one of those things that is very cheap compared to the amount of trouble involved when the needed screws are not somehow just laying around nearby.

As for the USB charging ports, I never expect much from the ones on power strips. I only use those to power or charge low-power 0.5-1A devices and these seem to do that just fine. I do not use them to charge phones or tablets or anything else these days that benefits from better chargers. So I didn't bother to test them with anything that can use more than 1A at most.

I also didn't check to see if the DC USB supply produces HF radio noise. This is a problem with a lot of cheap USB chargers that use switching power supplies without sufficient filter capacitors and such. It might be a problem for me except I haven't done any HF radio in a while, but anyway it's another potential quality issue that could use some testing. (For those who don't know, people doing HF ham radio often need to pick up weak long-distance radio signals that can easily be "jammed" by radio noise from poor quality electronics.)

So for my main requirements which are: can connect everything easily, can mount to back of wooden desk securely, and can charge low-power USB gadgets, this is a definite 5/5 with no headaches.

data.title: Excellent!
data.body:
I've got lots of things that need to be plugged in - there are various areas in my house and work spaces where I have multiple power adapter/charger type plugs and more.

The first truly fantastic thing about this is the FLAT PLUG that goes into the wall outlet. If you have an outlet that furniture or something needs to be as close to wall as possible, you don't want the standard sticking-out plug. The offset cord-plug means no problem plugging something else in the other wall outlet receptacle. The design with 4 outlets on top, and 2 outlets on each of 2 sides means I can actually use all 8 outlets if I need unlike any other power strip I have used in the past! (Because the power cubes/chargers inevitably prevent using some of the outlets.) When you add four USB ports on another side to provide charging, some surge protection with led indicator, and a velcro tie permanently and well-attached to the cord - and deliver one to me when it's on sale under $10!??? After I tried 1, I bought 4 more. These are great! (The product bottom has ETL and Intertek mark & I did locate the listing on the Intertek ETL directory with search on the model # ahr-803.) Now, don't expect super-fast charging from any of the USB charging ports, they are pretty much limited to max of 5watt-charge per port (I didn't try charging 4 things at once)

(I live in area where thunderstorms are very rare. I have lived in areas where that is not the case, and I would not rely on this, or any power strip, to provide surge protection. If the main service to your residence or workplace you plug into does not have adequate grounding and protection, the best you can hope for is your power strip gets damaged without affecting anything plugged into it when lightning strikes close enough to your service.)

data.title: I Like This - Brought Another One
data.body: I have a handicap where I need to use a cane and this surge protector power strip is just what I need when I can't get to the electrical outlet because of furniture hindering my access or the fact that the outlet is too low for me to reach without having to get on my knees or requiring me to sit down in front of the outlet. Of course, this entails me having to get up from a prone position. The beauty of this surge protector is with its long electrical cord, I'm able to place it wherever I need it at the level I need. With the capability to plug in eight devices, I'm able to plug in lights and/or Alexa assisted lights, phones, shredder, and computer related devices. If I happened to utilize all of the electrical outlets, I still have four USB ports I can use to charge devices all within easy reach of my hands.

data.title: Powerful Potential, But Not Without Pitfalls: The 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip Reviewed
data.body:
In a digital age where our lives are intertwined with a myriad of devices, the need for a reliable surge protector becomes paramount. The 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip, with its dual promise of safeguarding electronics and simplifying power management, caught my eye. Offering an array of eight electrical outlets and four USB ports, it seemed poised to declutter and streamline the energy consumption in my tech-heavy home environment. This surge protector suggested a solution to the perennial problem of insufficient charging points and the tangled web of cables that often plague our spaces.

However, as I integrated the surge protector into my daily routine, I encountered a blend of efficiency and limitations. While it adeptly powered a variety of devices, from laptops to kitchen appliances, the surge protector's real-world application illuminated both its strengths and areas in need of improvement. This nuanced experience provided a comprehensive understanding of its capability to meet the modern household's power demands.

Pros:

üîå Extensive Outlet Array: The expansive offering of outlets and USB ports transformed my workspace, reducing clutter and eliminating the need for additional power strips. This feature alone significantly elevated the utility of the surge protector, making it a central hub for all electronic charging needs.

Cons:

üîã USB Charging Speed: The convenience of built-in USB ports was tempered by their less-than-ideal charging speed. Compared to dedicated fast-charging adapters, these ports lagged, particularly noticeable when I needed a quick recharge for my devices.

Pros:

üîß Innovative Design Solutions: The surge protector's flat plug design was a subtle yet impactful feature, allowing furniture to be placed closer to the wall and freeing up space. The option for wall mounting offered further versatility, though it came with its own set of challenges.

Cons:

üõ† Stability with Wall Mounting: Despite the practicality of mounting the surge protector to save space, its design did not fully support the weight when loaded with multiple cables, leading to a slight sag. This did not impede functionality but raised questions about long-term durability and aesthetics.

As I reflect on my time with the 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip, it stands as a testament to the evolving needs of our connected lives. It capably addresses the demand for more power sources and the convenience of USB charging, yet it does not fully escape the shadow of its imperfections. The slow USB charging speeds and the minor issue with wall-mount stability highlight that while close to ideal, there is room for refinement.

This surge protector represents a significant stride towards the ideal of streamlined, efficient power management within our homes and workspaces. Its ability to reduce clutter and centralize charging stations underlines its value, making it a worthy consideration for anyone looking to enhance their power setup. As we continue to navigate the challenges of keeping our myriad devices powered and protected, the 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip serves as a reliable ally, albeit one that reminds us of the ongoing journey towards perfection in our digital ecosystem. Here‚Äôs to future innovations that will further bridge the gap between convenience and functionality.

data.title: Great for Travel
data.body:
Traveling in Europe, particularly in France and Spain, you need something that can handle their 220-240v power delivery from their outlets. This unit checks that box (provided you brought the proper converter for the plug).

Secondly, it is not uncommon to have only 2-3 outlets in a room, and some are not easy to get to. This power supply made it easy to keep our devices powered and charged throughout our travels all while having 4 outlets to spare. I won't travel without it.

data.title: Love it!
data.body: I attached this to the side of my vanity. I plug in my hair dryer, curling brush, and USB charging cables fory phone, make-up mirror and cordless fan. Everything is able to be plugged in at the same time! I used to have to plug and unplug various things under the vanity on the wall or when I used a power strip on the floor. This power block solves the problem!

data.title: Perfect size and portability
data.body: I use this especially when I go to work on my computer in a place that only has two outlets. There are many people who come into this establishment and can't find an available outlet at times. This allows many more of us to work out of one outlet and believe me, people are grateful when they see I have it and offer them to plug in.

data.title: Good price for lots of outlets
data.body:
Bought for the flat plug, it was less expensive than regular long surge protectors. I like all the outlet options that let you fit in more fatties.

It is pretty bulky though, so not suitable for slipping behind a nightstand. We shove ours under the bed. We also had to tape off an excessively bright status light, but that's par for the course these days.

data.title: Not to big for desktop
data.body: I needed an outlet for my desktop and to be small enough to hide under my screen shelf. The cord was long enough to go down through the desk and to the wall outlet. ot using it for travel, but I needed to move my computer connection cord from behind the desk to take with me when I do travel. This was cheaper than buying a second computer power cord.

data.title: Nice compact Surge Protector with USB ports
data.body: Have 4 of these now in my house that we use in Bedrooms. Nice to have a surge protector that has 8 - AC plugs and 3 USB A ports and 1 USB C port. USB supports 4.2A, each USB A port features 5V/2.4A Max output, USB C charging port features 5V/3A MAX. I have a Amazon Alexa device plugged in USB A in each room, along with a combo phone/watch wireless charger cradle plugged into USB C. It keeps everything tidy behind the nightstands. They are also useful behind the TV where we have multiple devices plugged in needing 120V as well as USB these days.

data.title: Works for all of our electronics in one spot.
data.body: I needed something to plug in my 2 laptops, cell phone and peripheral devices and this works great for that with just the right length of cord to go under the desk. I liked it so well I bought a second one.

data.title: Great for work trips!
data.body: This power block is great for my work trips. I'm able to power my laptop, phone, headphones, and anything else I need to wherever I'm at. I love that it has a surge protector as well. The cord is very flexible and easy to coil whenever I need to pack it away. I love how many outlets this thing has. I could easily let someone else plug into it as well without any issues. Keep in mind that you shouldn't buy this to use on cruise ships, as they don't usually allow power strips with surge protectors. For anything else, I'd highly recommend getting this!

data.title: Convenience.
data.body: Have purchased several of these devices and really happyy with the different areas provided for connectivity. With all the different sizes of our electronic devices a standard configuration protector can get overwhelmed. Price is also a positive.

data.title: Love It
data.body: We bought these to get rid of our old power strips on the floor next to our beds. We attached the new power strip to our bedside tables and consolidated all of our electronics in a much smaller space. We had to move our old strips to vacuum and to plug and/or unplug our chargers, laptop, lamp and phone, having everything on the night stand makes it much easier.

data.title: Perfect for a lot of plugs
data.body: I bought this to use for charging all of my electronics. It is perfect, there are numerous plugs and being square they are not all bunched up on top of each other in a single line. Even have USB outlets spots.

data.title: Emits a bright blue light
data.body: This works fine, and I like that it has so many ports, but I often charge my phone at night, and it emits a bright blue light from the top and from the ports on the side. Unfortunately, for those of sensitive to blue light and electronics, this won't work in a room in which you sleep.

data.title: Works great
data.body: I purchased 1 then came back and bought 3 more...I will be ordering more, everyone who sees them wants one...I have mounted them on the wall in each bedrm and my kids love them. They can charge numerous things at a time without having to unplug something else.

data.title: Really nice having the USB Ports along side the A/C plugs.
data.body:
This is really compact (5-6" square) with plenty of A/C plugs and USB ports, nice long cord too.
Perfect for traveling with the kids if you have a lot of devices you need to plug into.

data.title: Love this!!!
data.body: This is best extention cord I've ever had, let alone surge protector. Going to buy another one. I keep on my large counter because so easy to plug in appliances!! Highly recommend for anyone.

data.title: Love all the plugs and USB Ports
data.body: I like it that it has all of the plugs and USB ports. I have a rolling table that I have made for when I need to make my office portable and if I need or want to move my work somewhere else in the house since I work from home. I have laptop and portable monitor and I can plug it all into this device plus charger my phone using the USB C to USB C at a fast charge. When I use my table to play games by moving my consoles around sometimes I need a few different plugs and I can charge my controller using the USB ports all at the same time. I mounted this to the bottom of my table which works great to keep the cords in more of a neat fashion. Mostly I like the flat plug. So I can plug it into wherever without having to worry about it sticking out too far and not being able to plug it in. I also want to get another one for my arcade machine cabinet that I've made.

data.title: GREAT SURPRISE
data.body: I was just looking for extension cord and was surprised to find out this great little item had USB plug ins for my IPhone will order a couple more and also very. well made 5 STARS HANDS DOWN!

data.title: Love this for my office!
data.body: I really like this power strip! The length of the cord works great for my office because I do not have a lot of plugs. I really love the amount of outlets on this power strip. I am able to have multiple items plugged in at a time. I like the usb outlets as well. I would definitely recommend!

data.title: Works like it should
data.body:
This little guy is working just fine, as it is supposed to. The cord is length (6ft) works great for my set up.
No complaints after 5 months of owning it

data.title: Yishu Power Strip
data.body: I really like the fact that this power strip is compact! It works perfectly for my needs, ( iPad and iPhone ). Would recommend especially if there‚Äôs limited space..

data.title: Great Product - For the Price
data.body:
Works well as an extender. The multiple outlets are well designed and you can make use of all of the 8 outlets if you had to. I am making use 3 outlets and haven't had any problems. The USB charging ports are a big plus and I can multiple things at the same time pretty conveniently.

All in all a great product, worth the price!

data.title: Best ever!!
data.body: Love this! Just bought my 2nd one. It nice to keep on nightstand and plug in all the electronics and lamp and chargers. Do not hesitate! Order now!

data.title: Works great
data.body: It works just as well as any product similar I've had no issues with it even protected my devices plugged into it during a recent power surge

data.title: Worked great!
data.body: Used this in Dominican on vacation and it worked great. There were 4 people in one room with 1 outlet- this was a must!

data.title: Solidly built
data.body:
Like that you could plug up to 6 items in the 120V outlets. Additionally, 3 USB charging ports for other items and a 4th one, a USB C port. The USB C can‚Äôt be used for charging. No big deal.
Now, it is convenient because of the 6 ft electrical plug in cord to be able to put it on top of a night stand or dresser This prevents having to reach down and behind to plug in cables. It also has a shut off reset switch. Hopefully, it will last as I just got it.

data.title: Handy, Superb + Clever design!
data.body: Love the sturdiness, clever and sleek design with multiple extra ports and 3 prong plugs on 3 sides (!!). The extended and flat/ flush with wall cord design is especially nice. Will likely purchase another.

data.title: Well done
data.body:
It‚Äôs very good
It has space enough to connect different conectors, squares, round due the fact they are in different positions.
The material is good.

data.title: amazing for the price
data.body: This was one of the cheapest power strips I could get my hands on that actually came with more then 2 outlet holes. I've had 0 issues with it. If I need another ill for sure buy one of these again.

data.title: Hard to plug in ?
data.body: I love the device it‚Äôs amazing but for some reason you really have to really push the cords in it, maybe because it‚Äôs so new idk but other then that it‚Äôs a great product

data.title: Love it!
data.body: I have 6 cord I have plugged into plus a tablet, watch and phone. It's compact and I can hide it behind my night stand. Going to purchase another. I highly recommend this.

data.title: Perfect for bedside!
data.body: I can plug up my lamp, my Alexa and few chargers AND it has USB ports as well allowing me to charge my iPad mini, my ipad, 2 Amazon fire tablets all while Alexa is plugged in and the lamp is too! This thing is great!!!

data.title: Perfect size for small spaces
data.body: Not to bulky or long so it fits in small areas. It can be hung on the wall or attached to the back of furniture. I use it at my desk to keep my cords surge protected and organized.

data.title: Love!
data.body: I use this for all my plant lights. It has so many plugs and usb ports. I also like that you can mount it on the wall to keep it out of the way

data.title: Durable and plenty of space
data.body: Put this on our couch so we don't have to keep reaching behind to change our chargers for all our charging cords. The USB ports eliminate bases for multiple cords and the side outlets make it so the bulkier bases don't block the other outlets. Switch on it means it can be turned off to eliminate vampire electrical usage. It's very durable, as it gets kicked around a lot and sat on by our 80lb dog. Main cord is heavy duty.

data.title: Great adapter
data.body: this is a great adapter because you can put them in on the sides and on the front and I believe you can hook up your iPhone to it. It has a USB port.

data.title: Great Support
data.body: I had an issue with this after about 7 months. I reached out to the seller and they quickly resolved the issue.

data.title: As expected
data.body: I ravel a lot for work and this replaced all my charging blocks. Nice to have extension for power along with charging ports that don't use the few USB ports on my laptop

data.title: Perfect size
data.body: I haven't used it yet but I wanted something small that I can pack to take on trips. There's never enough outlets in hotel rooms. I think this will be perfect!!

data.title: Product exactly as listed
data.body: Great product. Very flexible. Solved a big problem I had in an almost inaccessible corner of my kitchen where I had two appliances and three devices but only one two outlet socket.

data.title: Awesome
data.body: It‚Äôs convenient to have by your chair. You don‚Äôt have to worry about not having a block or having plug ins for the lamp and such. Would buy again if I needed another.

data.title: Excellent power strip for the buck$
data.body:
Just received this power strip and am very impressed with it, especially for the money.
it has 8 outlets that arent crammed together, and 3 USB A ports and 1 USB-C port.

I liked it so much I just ordered another one, cant beat the price and value.

It even has 2 screw holes on the back so it can be mounted to a desk or wall.

data.title: Good for tight spots
data.body: I ordered this power strip because of the angled, flat plug, and the compactness of the power block itself. I use it in a spot where the wall plug can get pushed on by a bean bag chair, so this style helps prevent cord damage, and the small power block takes up less space on the floor. I also like the inclusion of both usb and usb-c ports, so I have options. I would buy these again.

data.title: Amazing
data.body: Absolutely amazing I love it. It‚Äôs plugged in behind my bed and I can move it and my cords everywhere

data.title: Works well
data.body: Bought this one to replace a different brand I bought that did not work. Great for nightstands for plugging in lamp, phone charger, Echo, CPAP, etc, etc all in one place, and not have to move bed to access the wall plug but the one time when this is plugged into the wall plug. Nice long cord to reach nightstand

data.title: A plug in for all your devices
data.body: I like that I could plug-in my iPad, watch and phone without having to have them spread all over the room. Has a 6 foot cord, which is handy and the plug console is compact despite the many plugs that it has available.

data.title: USB plugins really save space.
data.body: Very versatile and it really cleaned up my setup by not needing all the wall warts for each USB item.

data.title: great little gadgit
data.body: holds cords tight, love the extra space for usb, excellent spacing for outlets and it is great how it is flat so it fits kitchen counter great, love the flat plug!

data.title: Perfect!!
data.body: I like that I can plug in many items and it has plug ins for my phone charger

data.title: Great upgrade
data.body:
This puts those cheap old school power strips to shame.
USB ports are super to have as you can leave the cables attached for whenever you need a charge up.
The multiple sides of the outlets are amazing to have! The cord is also soft so it's flexible unlike the horrific stiff cords you're accustomed to. need more!

data.title: Great Versatility
data.body: I love this extension cord because it lays flat against the wall and has outlets on the sides! Also, I really like the quality of it. Feels well made.

data.title: Good for different size chargers
data.body: I like how this has plugs on the side and on top, and how it has USB outlets too - really helps accommodate big or weirdly shaped chargers.

data.title: Great for travel
data.body: We bought this for a trip to Disney to ensure we had enough plugs to charge all the things‚Ä¶phones, magic bands, portable charges, watches, etc. It worked perfectly for our needs for our trip.

data.title: Great for a WFH office
data.body: I had a regular power strip for my home office but found I was constantly unplugging something to make room to plug in something else. This surge protector was a perfect solution - plenty of room for the larger plugs of some of my equipment plus the USB slots for my phone charger.

data.title: Don't plug to many things in
data.body: The more you have plugged in the less power those items get. i noticed that if i turn on my computer the lights go dim. could be my house though as its on the older side but also never had a issue with this with my older one. So I'm on the fence really.

data.title: Great Price for excellent product
data.body: I‚Äôm so impressed with this surge protector! It is nice and compact and full of outlets. I especially love the USB and C chargers! I would highly recommend this product.

data.title: Good quality for the price
data.body: It seems like it‚Äôs built well. All of the ports work and what is plugged in fits snugly.

data.title: Great outlet placement
data.body: I really like how this is set up. It's perfect for the spot I needed something. I like that it is compact. Not a long strip like a lot of others.

data.title: Convenient
data.body: I love this multi-plug, I have it in my craft room and makes my life easier when shifting between equipments. The best part is the on/off button. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great product!
data.body: I like how you can switch it on and off without unplugging it. Would buy again.

data.title: Lots of way to connect
data.body: We put this on the back of my side table. Easy access, lots of way to connect my devices. Easy to reach because it's up off the floor.

data.title: Great Product
data.body: Everything I asked for. works great for what I needed it for. not to heavy to hang from the wall by nails even with things plugged into it.

data.title: Enough outlets to power electronic devices
data.body:
Bought this power strip to power my computer and accessories.

What I like?
- Has enough outlets for my devices.
- Good separation between outlets compared to my previous power strip.
- Good quality and value.
- Square design versus rectangular design. Preference will depend on individual needs.

Overall, good buy and recommend.

data.title: great when you need extra outlets with just one plug
data.body: I really like the fact that I can use my wall outlet- using one outlet plug for 8 outlets & 4 USB ports & have the other wall outlet free for something that has to be plugged directly into one outlet not a surge protector. When I'm sitting on my sofa with my I pad Air, plus anything that has a USB, I can easily plug into the USB port surge protector. Also it gives me peace of mind being a surge protector for my tech equipment.

data.title: Great outlet for a large plug need with differently shaped plugs.
data.body: We have one of these on each side of our couch to control the electronics in the couch, the end table lights, a charger, and more. With some of the plugs taking up the space of 2 outlets on a regular strip this gadget is the perfect way around those cumbersome plugs.

data.title: doesnt cause a surge like a different one did and is nice and compact
data.body:
i had a different tower-like power strip with three sides. and every time id turn on my vibration plate, there would be like an electrical surge (i don know if thats the correct terminology) -my ceiling bulb would dim. wihout fail, every time. i accepted thats just how things are, but also i was tired of how bulky that tower was so i got this one and i loooove the usb ports and how sleek it it. good design. and my light stays the same brightness, no dimming, when i turn on the vibration plate!!

now i have only had this about a week i think so i cant speak to longevity yet, which is important. but i did buy 5 more to put all around the house. now that we've got usb cables/chargers permenantly in the usb spaces, we have extra plug spaces when we need them. i love this so far and hope it lasts.

data.title: Great for your desk.

data.title: Like it
data.body: Works great. I like the design and the cords laying flat makes me feel happy.

data.title: Works I think
data.body: While being used for higher energy draining things like heaters it will self reset and stop. So it's good for low draw items I think but not anything over 600 watts.

data.title: Small
data.body: What I have been looking for, 8 outlet surge protector that was not foot and a half long. Fits perfectly under desk in a small space.

data.title: Heavy duty
data.body: The build quality is very sturdy and well made. Thick gauge wire plug, gives the safety confidence needed in a power surge protector, and has worked with all my electronics I wanted to plug in.

data.title: Works great
data.body: Use this master plug base to charge my golf cart and also a 12 volt battery for my chemical sprayer. Works great and prevents overloads

data.title: Great power plug!
data.body: This item works awesome! A lot of outlets, great quality and super easy to install!

data.title: 3-side power strip with 8AC widely outlets
data.body: I am very much pleased with this product, it has 3-side power strip with 8AC widely outlets and 4 USB charging ports. My desk now looks so cleaned with this multi functional extension.

data.title: Works well with multiple AC adapters
data.body: I purchased this item because it seemed like it would be more functional than a standard power strip for a couple of places I need to plug in several items with bulky "wall wart" AC adapters at the same time. The four top outlets fit that purpose very well, leaving the outlets along the sides available for plugging in other items.

data.title: Excellent!
data.body: Works well! Great versatility and easy to use. Packs up for travel with no issues.

data.body: Can charge my bluetooth headphones on it, has USB ports on it. Very handy.

data.body: i use this for my computer systems. All the plugs are distant enough to allow for all the different power supply configurations.
